isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI - 466 A AND B SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - MEASURE SMOKE INTENSITY DT/DTI-466 A and B Series (With UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pump) - General Description

svcproc.title: General Description
svcproc.para: The smoke sampling kit (SE-2580) is used to measure smoke levels at the exhaust pipe at full load and rated speed.
The smoke sampling kit (SE-2580) sampling pump draws off a precise amount of exhaust gas from the exhaust pipe of the respective engine and then sucks it through a filter paper disk.

The filter paper disk, in turn, darkens during this process and thus gives the measure of the soot content of the exhaust gases. The filter disk is then compared to the Bacharach Oil Burner Smoke Scale Figure
5.35
(Chart II). The Bosch smoke number is then determined and compared to the standards given in the Performance Data Guidelines, in this section.

important.para: WHEN USING THE SMOKE SAMPLING KIT SE-2580 FOLLOW THE INSTRUMENT MANUFACTURERS OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS TO ASSURE ACCURATE READINGS. DO NOT DEVIATE FROM THOSE INSTRUCTIONS.
DO NOT COMPARE SAMPLING DISCS WITH THE SMOKE SCALE REPRESENTED IN CHART II. USE ONLY THE ACTUAL BACHARACH SCALE.

svcproc.para: **Chart II compares darkness of filter paper to Robert Bosch Smoke Number.
